channel.title: Green Ruby
channel.description: Green Ruby News is a feed of fresh links of the week about ruby, javascript, webdev, devops, collected by mose every sunday

item.title: Green Ruby News #177
item.content:encoded:
#177 - jun 26th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
MockupEditor
Create instant mockups of your scene.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Remotely Awesome
Remote jobs aggregation website.
Jobspresso
JFind remote jobs and careers.
Authentic Jobs
Web, Design, Freelance, and Tech Jobs.
Upwork
Get Freelance Jobs Online.
Dr. Jekyll's Themes
A Jaekyll theme directory.
Git-tips
Most commonly used git tips and tricks.
PG Casts
PostgreSQL screencasts from the people at Hashrocket.
2016 State of DevOps Report
The annual Puppet report with data about devops.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.4.0-preview1 jun 20
Many features improvement, they say.
Rails 5.0.0.rc2 jun 24
Details of the last RC release for Rails 5.
Groupify
Add group and membership functionality to your Rails models.
Action_access
Access control system for Ruby on Rails.
Iris
A fast web framework in Go.
Elixir 1.3 jun 21
Various fixes and new evolutions.
Verk
A job processing system that just verks!
Places
Turn any input into an address autocomplete

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
About controlling the Referer header jun 20
Everything you could ever want to know (and more) about controlling the Referer header.
Redesign Hacker News jun 20
The 5 areas to improve, how and why.
A Review Of Immutability In Ruby jun 21
Options available to Rubyists regarding immutability.
Content Jumping (and How To Avoid It) jun 21
One of the more eye-twinging behaviors of web sites and some possibilities.
Behavior changes in Ruby 2.4 jun 22
Changes that are not entirely backward compatible.
Liberate Your Search in Rails with Tags jun 23
How to take a complicated search model and open it up with tags.
Getting Started with Hapi.js jun 23
An alternative to express.js.
Understanding Elixir's Ecto Querying DSL jun 24
Basics of querying with Elixir's Ecto library, going through joins, associations, aggregation functions, and so on.
10 benefits of Code Review for the win jun 24
Problem: People make mistakes.
The shape of open source jun 24
At its core, open source is about collaboration. Here are some graphs.
Ruby script to achieve fast incremental back-up on btrfs partition jun 24
The script and the details about it.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Drifting Ruby #34 (3m) jun 19
Some neat tips and tricks for interacting with and parsing JSON responses from an API.

item.title: Green Ruby News #176
item.content:encoded:
#176 - jun 19th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Timelike
A visual experiment showing your likes from the face book.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
An interview with Mike Perham jun 22
Sidekiq creator interview on Remote Meetup. Join in!
Best-ruby
Ruby Tricks, Idiomatic Ruby, Refactorings and Best Practices
Javascript WYSIWYG editors
A list of web-based WYSIWYG editor.
Pixel Art to CSS
An online editor for pixel art animations.
Berkeley AI Materials
UC Berkeley CS188 Intro to AI -- Course Materials
WebTorrent
WebTorrent, the streaming torrent client for the browser, OS X, Windows, and Linux
CodeComet
Version Control, Collaboration & Coding for Front-end Developers (in beta).
2016 Guide to User Data Security
A quite complete guide for strengthening your servers security.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
FasterPath
This gem shaves off more than 30% of my Rails application page load time.
Mechanize
The Mechanize library is used for automating interaction with websites.
CASino
Single Sign On (SSO) web application written in Ruby
Rack-cas
Simple Rack middleware to perform CAS client authentication.
Clearance
Rails authentication with email & password.
Sharedb
A database frontend for concurrent editing systems
Habitat
Automation that travels with the app.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
50 Most Common Ruby on Rails Mistakes Beginner Developers Make jun 13
The list of common Ruby on Rails mistakes that beginner developers are unaware of/do wrong or don’t do at all. And how to avoid them.
Ruby Ranges: How Do They Work? jun 14
Discover how Ruby ranges work under the hood.
Metaprogramming in Ruby jun 15
Metaprogramming is fantastic but only when it is used sparingly.
Hands-on Functional Programming with Ramda.js jun 15
Ramda.js is a library that we can use to help us getting started with functional programming using JavaScript.
An Introduction to Elixir’s Ecto Library jun 15
Ecto is the main library for working with databases in Elixir.
Samsung acquires Joyent: A CTO’s perspective jun 15
Quite a big news this week. Here is an insider insight.
Accessing the User’s Camera with JpegCamera and Canvas jun 16
JpegCamera takes the pain out of using the user’s camera in your application without needing to worry about cross-browser compatibility.
How to Find Cool, Quirky, Copyright Free Photos on Flickr jun 16
Find images that are in the public domain and copyright free.
Quick Tip: Add Favicons Quickly and Easily to Your HTML jun 16
Favicons generally aren’t easy to manage. Because of the fragmentation of both mobile and desktop operating systems and browsers.
Preserving session with Mechanize jun 17
The Mechanize library is used for automating interaction with websites.

item.title: Green Ruby News #175
item.content:encoded:
#175 - jun 12th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
NewActon
A community website with interesting graphical setup.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ruby on libhunt
An alternative to the old ruby-toolbox?
curl-to-ruby
Convert curl commands to ruby's net/http.
Reserved Words in Ruby on Rails
The list, searchable.
Awesome-crystal
A collection of awesome Crystal libraries, tools, frameworks and software.
Mega Boilerplate
Handcrafted starter projects generator.
Teambl
Manage a blog using slack.
Codacy
A decent alternative to Codeclimate.
Commit Logs From Last Night
Watch your language, or end up there. Or curse on purpose to end up there, up to you.
NewsletterStash
Discover newsletters worth subscribing to. Browse newsletters directory by category, type and frequency.
Bug Bounty Weekly
Newsletter about Bug Bounties.
API Docs
Hosted public API documentation for every OAS (Swagger) and RAML spec out there.
Copper
People sign up with their mobile number.
The Art of Monitoring
(book) A hands-on introductory book on the art of modern application and infrastructure monitoring and metrics.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Databound
Provides Javascript a simple CRUD API to the Ruby on Rails backend.
Rack-mini-profiler
Profiler for your development and production Ruby rack apps.
Kemal
Like Sinatra but in Crystal.
jQuery 3.0 Final Released jun 9
Few breaking changes, but not as many as the last one.
hackathon-starter
A boilerplate for Node.js web applications for hackathons.
Hublin
An easy and free video conference service #webrtc
mjml
A responsive email framework.
Træfɪk
Modern HTTP reverse proxy and load balancer made to deploy microservices with ease.
jekyll-octopod
A podcast publishing extension for the static site generator Jekyll.
Swagger
Framework for APIs.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Exploring Cryptography Fundamentals in Ruby jun 6
Basic walkthrough of cryptography in Ruby.
Using Ruby with ActiveRecord in AWS Lambda jun 6
It's much easier to launch a 1000 AWS Lambdas at the same time than running Ruby processes with resque or sidekiq on worker boxes.
Building a WebRTC Video Chat Application with PeerJS jun 7
PeerJS is a JavaScript library that simplifies WebRTC peer-to-peer data, video, and audio calls.
Interactive Data Visualization: Animating the viewBox jun 8
The viewBox acts as a window in which you see in to your SVG.
Expose Your Rails CRUD to the Browser with Databound jun 9
Databound provides Javascript a simple CRUD API to the Ruby on Rails backend.
JavaScript Object Creation: Patterns and Best Practices jun 9
Various styles of object creation and how each builds on the others in incremental steps.
Quick Tip: How z-index and Auto Margins Work in Flexbox jun 9
Explore some flexbox tricks.
Introducing Drizzle jun 9
Tool for generating pattern libraries and style guides.
The Importance of Code Reviews jun 10
Apparently, it’s not obvious to everyone that code reviews are actually helpful.

item.title: Green Ruby News #174
item.content:encoded:
#174 - jun 5th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Waaark
French Creative Web Studio.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
The Vanilla Javascript Repository
Coz' sometimes you feel guilty for using jQuery.
HyperDev
Developer playground for building web app fast.
Project Soli
New interaction sensor using radar technology.
Rove
Service that allows you to pregenerate typical Vagrant builds

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Time Math
TimeMath2 is a small, no-dependencies library attempting to make time arithmetics easier.
sysrandom
Secure random number generation for Ruby using system RNG facilities
Related
Pure Ruby relational algebra.
Janky
Continuous integration server built on top of Jenkins and Hubot
Temple
Template compilation framework in Ruby
Oasis.js
A lightweight library for embedding untrusted content and exposing capabilities.
Xeon
Module loader for shell scripts with 'require' style.
Bluebird
Full featured promise library with unmatched performance.
Family.scss
Set of 24 smart Sass mixins to manage the style of :nth-child’ified elements.
Flex Layout Attribute
Custom HTML layout attribute designed to serve you as quick flexbox shorthand.
Texttop
A fully interactive X Linux desktop rendered in TTY and streamable over SSH
Black-screen
A terminal emulator for the 21st century (made with electron).
Lantern
Internet proxy tool that lets you access blocked sites

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
A Comprehensive Guide to Interacting With IMAP Using Ruby may 30
All the steps to make your ruby app become a mail client.
Abstractions and the role of a framework may 30
This is a follow-up to the discussion that was started last week 'My time with Rails is up'.
Beyond YML Files may 31
Save translation into database and users can edit it from the Rails app.
3 pleasantly surprising postgreSQL indexing tricks may 31
A few quite advanced indexing techniques.
Saving Sprockets may 31
What do you do when a maintainer leaves a project with over 51 million downloads?
Harnessing the Google Maps JavaScript API the Right Way jun 1
There are lots of tutorials and examples already out there for this, but too often without a focus on the best way of achieving the desired result.
IFacebook's text understanding engine jun 1
DeepText can understand with near-human accuracy the textual content of several thousand posts per second, spanning more than 20 languages.
Learn Concurrency by Making a Countdown Latch in Ruby jun 2
A Countdown Latch is a concurrency abstraction that allows one or more threads to wait until all other threads are done with what they are doing.
Regular Expressions in JavaScript june 2
What, exactly, regular expressions are and what they can do for you.
Introducing the CSS clip-path Property jun 2
clip-path is css3 a property which allows you to prevent a portion of an element from being displayed.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Get a Whiff of This by Sandi Metz (38m) may 28
Most new requirements change existing code. Ergo, much our work involves altering imperfect code.

item.title: Green Ruby News #173
item.content:encoded:
#173 - may 29th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Sagmeister & Walsh
NYC based design firm with an excellent website.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
HEAD
A list of everything that could go in the head of your html page.
Nix
Package manager for Unix and Linux systems.
what-happens-when
What happens when you type google.com into your browser's address box and press enter? With all the details.
Wirify
Turn any web page into a wireframe in one click.
Algorithm Visualizer
Tool for visualizing algorithms.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
vimrunner
Control a vim instance through ruby code.
fake_stripe
Mock stripe connections and return proper JSON responses for test.
Password_strength
Check password strength against several rules. Includes ActiveRecord/ActiveModel support.
Sanitize
Whitelist-based Ruby HTML and CSS sanitizer.
Massive-js
A Postgres-centric Data Access Tool for NodeJS.
Bideo.js
Easy Fullscreen HTML5 Background Video
Push.js
A compact, cross-browser solution for using the JavaScript Notifications API.
Spectre.css
A lightweight, responsive CSS framework.
Nitlanguage.org
A fun language for serious programming.
Atom and Pinegrow
A full IDE for the web.
Docker-lambda
Docker images and test runners that replicate the live AWS Lambda environment

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
My time with Rails is up may 22
A rant about ruby, with a uselessly dramatic title.
Rails has won: The Elephant in the Room may 23
Reflection on the previously cited controversy letter by solnic.eu.
Please help me to not go broke may 23
Avdi Grimm get desperate, because he's supposedly bad at marketing. Still, he's a cool ruby activist.
Know Ruby: with_index may 24
each_with_index is a combination of each.with_index, the article explains what's different between them.
Contributing to Open Source Software with Git may 25
Learn what is open source software and how you can make your contributions to a open source project using Git.
Open Sourcing Twitter Heron may 25
Heron is a proven, production-ready, real-time stream processing engine, now open sourced.
What the Format? may 26
Ruby comes with a structured alternative to classic string interpolation.
Make a Simple JavaScript Slideshow without jQuery may 26
The main benefits of not using a library for your slideshow are that your page performs better.
Quick Tip: 4 Really Useful, Re-Useable Code Snippets from Codepen may 28
The world’s best front-end people deliver their ideas to us in pretty windows.

item.title: Green Ruby News #172
item.content:encoded:
#172 - may 22th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Studio Rotate
Simple and classy brand design.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ruby Remote Meetups
Why meetups should always be physical!? Remote it up!
RbConfig
List of all configuration variables in RbConfig.
Cronally
Schedule cron jobs on AWS instances.
Segment
Analytics API and customer data hub.
Certbot
Lets encrypt client becomes Certbot.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Gush
Workflow runner using Sidekiq and Redis.
mock_server
A lightweight Sinatra application for mock HTTP responses.
typhoeus
Wraps libcurl for making fast and reliable requests.
MiniRacer
Minimal, modern embedded V8 for Ruby.
Paranoia
acts_as_paranoid for Rails 3 and 4.
Brainruby
Ruby... Optimized for Developer Sadness.
Cutestrap
A sassy, opinionated CSS Framework. A tiny alternative to Bootstrap.
Dracula Theme
Dracula is a dark theme for Sublime, Atom, Alfred, Emacs, iTerm, JetBrains, Slack, Sublime Text, Textmate...
Dstat
Versatile resource statistics tool.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Procs and Lambdas: Closures in Ruby may 16
An in-depth look into Ruby's proc and lambda.
5 useful examples from the Ruby Standard Library may 16
The Ruby Standard Library is a series of modules & classes that come with Ruby but are not part of the language itself.
How to get started with a Content Security Policy may 17
A Content Security Policy (CSP) is a great way to reduce or completely remove Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.
Running concurrent workflows in Ruby may 18
Have you ever struggled with a chain of rake tasks that needed to be run periodically and their runtime was giving you a headache?
Untangling Spaghetti Code: How to Write Maintainable JavaScript may 18
With proper planning, analysis, and a good workflow, it is possible to turn a spaghetti codebase into a clean, organised, and scalable one.
All or Nothing may 18
The all property is a shortcut for resetting all of the properties on a given element.
CSS coding techniques may 18
Some tips and recommendation to write better, easier-to-maintain CSS code.
Get the Lowdown on Ruby Modules may 19
Some developers are still confused about how modules work and how they interact with their own code.
Web Image Effects Performance Showdown may 19
tl;dr: Just don't use canvas for filters.
A bit about decorators and presenters may 20
Dive in to the decorator and presenter pattern and see what makes them simillar, but unique.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Building Fast & Resilient Web Applications (40m) may 20
Carving out the fast path is not enough. We need to make our applications resilient.

Look

A list of command line tools for manipulating structured text data

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.

rails_soft_deletable
Soft deletable support of ActiveRecord.
fbctf

gitsome
A Git/shell autocompleter with GitHub integration.
amazon-dsstne
Deep Scalable Sparse Tensor Network Engine (DSSTNE) is an Amazon developed library for building Deep Learning (DL) machine learning (ML) models
gitsome
A supercharged Git/shell autocompleter with GitHub integration.
DistributedLog
High-performance, replicated log service by Twitter.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Store your private data inside a git repository may 8
By git-secret.
Rails Performance and the root of all evil may 9
Make sure the difference is significant before performance refactoring.
Implementing WebSockets in Rails 5 with Action Cable May 9
The real-time web
Knuckles, The Next Level of API Caching may 10
Better caching, in the lineage of Perforated.
How to Build a Math Evaluation Engine may 11
Use tokenization to parse string and build an evaluator.
Don't Forget About Infinite Enumerators may 11
Ways to create a enumerator contains infinity loop.
It Takes All Kinds may 11
Some thoughts about our development ecosystems.
Electron 1.0 is here may 11
Desktop applications—making using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Now with a stable API.
Introducing unlimited private repositories may 11
The new pricing scheme for Github.
A Brain Dump of What I Worked on for Uncharted 4 may 11
Not the usual topics, but Allen is a friend and game mechanics are cool when exposed.
Advanced Ping: httping, dnsping, smtpping may 11
If it pings it's alive.
Grafana 3.0 Stable Released may 11
A pretty good milestone for that emerging star in monitoring world.
DevOps and sharing may 13
Great talk about devops culture.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Make Ruby Great Again on Vimeo (39m) may 9
Talk about RSpec and Rails 5.

item.title: Green Ruby News #170
item.content:encoded:
#170 - may 8th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Pixels by Tomer Lerner
A Designer website, showcasing various projects.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Resources for machine learning in Ruby
A collection of gems and other sources about machine learning in Ruby.
No more errors
A handy list of Ruby's error.
Losant
Internet of Things developer platform.
DevopsWiki
A wiki of Devops Tools, Tutorials and Scripts
SeaLion
View raw output for critical events across servers

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
serviceworker-rails
Use Service Workers with the Rails asset pipeline.
rails-auth
Modular resource-based authentication and authorization for Rails/Rack.
seed_dump
Rails 4/5 task to dump real database data to db/seeds.rb
net-http2
A HTTP/2 client for Ruby.
Redis 3.2.0 is out
This is a big upgrade with various new features for Redis.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Lug-Nut Driven Development (LuDDite) May 2
Some basic principles used for growing a codebase.
Container-Ready Rails 5 May 2
Rails 5 will be the easiest release ever to get running on Heroku.
How to Generate Weighted Random Numbers May 3
Two ways to generate weighted random numbers.
Introducing the CSS Grid Layout May 3
The importance of grids in modern web design is clear from the number of frameworks that implement the grid system to speed up development.
The biggest Rails code smell you should avoid to keep your app healthy May 4
Quick prototyping benefit comes with a cost.
Exploring the Structure of Ruby Gems May 4
Explain how gems loaded to your project.
Saving Bandwidth with Chrome’s Data Saver May 4
Data Saver is a new feature for Chrome that works to reduce mobile data usage significantly.
How to Implement Smooth Scrolling in Vanilla JavaScript May 5
Discover advantages of using CSS solution in this article.
How to Implement Java’s equals Method Correctly May 5
Any implementation of equals must adhere to a specific contract or the class’s equality is ill-defined and all kinds of unexpected things happen.
Use React Today in Ruby by Heading to Cuba May 5
You’ve all heard of React. It’s no longer the new kid on the block.
ImageMagick Is On Fire — CVE-2016–3714 May 5
This vulnerability is tragically easy to exploit.

item.title: Green Ruby News #169
item.content:encoded:
#169 - may 1st 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
The End of the Internet
At the end there was just a map.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ruby Web Dev The Other Way
Personal ruby web development best practices guide by Ievgen Kuzminov.
CSS Hexagon Generator
Generate your own pure CSS hexagons with box-shadow, border, and background image.
Glot.io
An open source pastebin with runnable snippets and API.
Typatone
The act of writing has always been an art. Now, it can also be an act of music.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.3.1 Released apr 26
This is the first TEENY version release of the stable 2.3 series, there are many bugfixes.
Thredded
A Rails 4.2+ forum engine.
Bumbler
Track the load progress of your Bundler-based projects.
Apnotic
An Apple Push Notification gem able to provide instant feedback.
Memdump
Command line manipulation and analysis tool for Ruby 2.1+ memory dumps.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Blocks, Procs, and Enumerable apr 25
Some basics of ruby, exposed.
A basic HTML5 Template for any project apr 25
As you learn HTML5 and add new techniques to your toolbox, you’re likely going to want to build yourself boilerplate.
Unobtrusive JavaScript via AJAX in Rails apr 26
JavaScript outside of HTML’s page structure not to pollute it.
Improving the Quality of Your CSS with PostCSS apr 26
A way to raise quality in CSS code.
Creating Animated Google Map Markers with CSS and JavaScript apr 26
The Google Maps API lacks flexibility and creativity with map markers.
3 Lightweight React Alternatives: Preact, VirtualDom & Deku apr 26
Why those alternatives might be right for your next project.
5 Career-Ending Mistakes Web Developers Make apr 26
Well, here is a stupid title for a list of common sense points on how to keep a healthy relationship with customers.
Being A Developer After 40 apr 26
Story and insights from a 42 years-old developer.
Have Software Developers Given Up? apr 26
Collection of screenshots from last month demonstrating that the web is full of bugz.
Don’t just check errors, handle them gracefully apr 27
Presentation at the recent GoCon spring conference in Tokyo, Japan.
Switch Git Branches by partial name apr 27
Pretty useful in large projects.
Build a Music Player with React & Electron II: Making the UI apr 27
From mockup to full code.
An Introduction to Using JWT Authentication in Rails apr 28
All you need to know abotu JSON Web Tokens.
Slack bot token leakage exposing business critical information apr 28
Developers are leaking access tokens for Slack widely on GitHub, in public repositories.
How to Use JSON Data Fields in MySQL Databases apr 29
The line between SQL and NoSQL databases has become increasingly blurred.

item.title: Green Ruby News #168

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...

Creating Wavescroll apr 20

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
